meanings.definition: Relating to or being a holotype.
meanings.sent1: The holotypic specimen was used to define the new species.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the holotypic characteristics of the fossil.
meanings.sent3: The museum curator joked that the holotypic dinosaur was the pickiest eater.
meanings.sent4: Her attention to detail was holotypic, like a master artist's brushstrokes.
meanings.sent5: The holotypic features of the flower made it stand out among the rest.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to a holotype.
meanings.sent1: The holotypic classification helped in identifying the unique species.
meanings.sent2: Researchers compared the holotypic traits of various specimens.
meanings.sent3: The holotypic book in the library always seemed to be misplaced.
meanings.sent4: His dedication to his work was holotypic, setting him apart from others.
meanings.sent5: The holotypic nature of the painting captured everyone's attention.

meanings.sent1: The holotypic label on the specimen indicated its significance.
meanings.sent2: The holotypic characteristics were crucial for species identification.
meanings.sent3: She jokingly referred to her messy desk as holotypic chaos.
meanings.sent4: The holotypic symbol on the map marked the location of the rare plant.
meanings.sent5: His holotypic approach to problem-solving yielded innovative solutions.
